chunks.text: Next question is about sum of a and b
You must be thinking that we have already asked this question
But now we will do it with a small twist
Earlier when we had taken sum of a and b
What we had done was
We had declared variables
This time we will take input of these variables
How we will take input?
Using scanner object
So first of all we have to make our scanner object in code
So we will make scanner object
After that we will input an integer a
With the help of sc.nextint
After that we will input an integer b
Using sc.nextint
After that we will create a sum variable
Int sum
And in that we will do a plus b
And finally we will print the value of sum
So we have added a small extra step
Which is scanner object
And this time instead of writing value
We have inputted the value from the user
What will be the benefit of this?
The benefit will be that you have made a code
Which automatically calculates sum for you
And you can enter any value of your numbers
So let's do this code
To write code we have imported our package
Means we have to write this line
If we want to use scanner
Means if we want to take any input
After that we will write scanner sc is equal to
new scanner system.in
First of all we will take input variable
Integer a is equal to sc.nextint
After that we will take input variable b
sc.nextint
I hope we are getting this sc.nextint
After that we will make a third variable sum
What values are going to be written in sum?
A plus b value
And finally we will print
System.out.printlnsum
Let's save this and run it
First of all we have to enter a value
We have entered a as 10
Then we will enter b value
We have entered b as 5
After that what happened?
For us sum was calculated
10 plus 5 is equal to 15
That variable will be made in memory
And then sum was printed for us on the screen
Which is given as 15
If we want we can put any other value
Instead of a and b
If we want instead of integer
We can take float
We are summing floating values
So we have made a full fledged program
Our first program
In which we are taking input values
In which we are doing some calculation
In which we have defined variables
And in which we have shown some output
So this is a big success in programming
If you have understood how we have written the code
How we have taken input and output
How we have defined variables
How we have assigned values
If you have understood this much
Then we are doing a great job in programming
Because logically understanding this is a big thing
So congratulations
And I hope we have understood this well
And in the same way
We will be building a lot of logic in the coming programs
